Being a vindication of that ingenious and innocent sex from the biting sarcasms, bitter satyrs, and opprobrious calumnies, wherewith they are daily, tho undeservedly, aspers'd by the virulent tongues and pens of malevolent men. ...
titleStmt.author: Norris, James, fl.1682-1684
Harefinch, John, fl. 1682-1690, printer

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Jo. Harefinch for James Norris, at the Kings Arms without Temple-Bar.,

notesStmt.note: Attributed to James Norris by Wing (2nd ed.).
Reissued 1684 with title: The acomplish'd lady, or Deserving gentlwoman.
Advertisement: "Books printed for Ja. Norris at the Kings-Arms without Temple-Bar, 1683." -- p. [1] at end.
Reproduction of original in: William Andrews Clark Memorial Library, University of California, Los Angeles.
